On Escalation Ticket # 00434193 the new comment has been added: Ethan Israel:

@Salesforce @Helen Randall - 
per discussion on the Technical Knowledge share, relaying guidance from dev on what to look out for if an issue like this comes up:

Below is what we have seen. Why the stacktrace relates to the issue is that SafeAccessTokenHandles are not being finalized, so when our code re-impersonates, there are none left. This could happen with other OS resources that have a limit however:


--- CODE ---
System.Security.SecurityException at
System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.SafeImpersonate(Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeAccessTokenHandle,
System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity, System.Threading.StackCrawlMark
ByRef) at
System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.Impersonate(System.Threading.StackCrawlMark
ByRef) at
System.Security.SecurityContext.SetSecurityContext(System.Security.SecurityContext,
Reader, Boolean, System.Threading.StackCrawlMark ByRef) at
System.Threading.ExecutionContext.SetExecutionContext(System.Threading.ExecutionContext,
Boolean) at
System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(System.Threading.ExecutionContext,
System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean) at
System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext,
System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean) at
System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext,
System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object) at
System.Net.ContextAwareResult.Complete(IntPtr) at
System.Net.LazyAsyncResult.ProtectedInvokeCallback(System.Object, IntPtr) at
System.Net.Sockets.BaseOverlappedAsyncResult.CompletionPortCallback(UInt32,
UInt32, System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*) at
System.Threading._IOCompletionCallback.PerformIOCompletionCallback(UInt32,
UInt32, System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
--- CODE ---

In the EventLogs, souce: .NET Runtime, Application: StealthAudit.EXE
